C. will serve the LORD though He is a jealous 
God’ 
D. cannot put away the foreign gods among us 
because our fathers served them’. 
 
13. God’s anger was kindled against Eli and his children 
because Eli did not 
A. train his children in the way of the LORD 
B. warn his children against sin 
C. apply appropriate sanctions on his children 
when due 
D. know the gravity of their actions. 
 
14. The prophets whom Saul met at Gibeath-elohim a 
confirmation that the LORD had anointed him 
to rule over God’s people, were 
A. false prophets B. ecstatic prophets 
C. court prophets D. classical prophets 
 
15. While David was being anointed king, he received 
A. a protest from Saul 
B. the promise of eternal reign 
C. a gift from Samuel 
D. the Spirit of the LORD. 
 
16. Against whom were the Israelites fighting when King 
David committed adultery with Uriah’s wife? 
A. The Amorites   B. The Ammonites 
C. The Hittites D. The Syrians 
 
17. According to Psalm 51, the sacrifice acceptable to God is. 
A. a clean heart 
B. obedience 
C. a lamb without blemish 
D. a broken spirit 
 
18. Solomon could devote his attention to the building of 
the house of the LORD because 
A. of the supplies from the Queen of Sheba 
B of Hiram’s co-operation 
C. there was neither adversary nor misfortune 
D. of David’s purchase of the site for the building. 
 
19. The immediate cause of the division of the kingdom 
was 
A. Rehoboam’s foolishness 
B. Solomon’s bad government 
C. Prophet Ahijah’s instigation 
D. Jeroboam’s rebellion. 
 
20. “Arise go to Zarephath, which belongs to Sidon, and 
dwell there. Behold, I have commanded a widow there 
to feed you”. 
What exactly necessitated this event? 
 
22. According to the birth and infancy narratives in St. 
Matthew, the angel of the Lord appeared to Joseph in a 
dream three times. In the second appearance, he instructed 
Joseph to 
A. accept that Mary was a virgin 
B. expect a baby boy 
C. go into exile D. return form exile. 
 
23, “Lord, now lettest thou thy servant depart in peace, 
according to thy word; for mine eyes have seen thy 
salvation …” 
This was said at the dedication  of Jesus by 
A. Anna   B.   the  high priest C. Simeon 
D. Zechariah 
 
24. “You brood of vipers! Who warned you to flee from the 
wrath to come? 
A. Pharisees and the Sadducees 
B. Pharisees and the Scribes 
C. Sadducees and the Lawyers 
D. Zealots and the Herodians 
 
25. The second temptation of Jesus according to Luke’s 
account of the gospel was 
A. giving the kingdoms of the world to Jesus if 
he would worship the devil 
B. a command for a stone to become bread 
C. jumping down from the pinnacle of the temple 
D. denying the name of God, the Father, 
 
26. What did Christ say should be the qualification of whoever 
was to be first or great among the apostles? 
A. Being baptized with Christ’s baptism 
B. Being a slave of all 
C. Giving one’s life as a ransom 
D. Drinking from the same cup as Jesus, 
 
27. A would-be disciple, who puts his hand to the plough 
and looks back, lacks 
A. faith B.   kindness C. repentance 
D. total commitment. 
 
28. In which miracle story was Jesus mistaken for a ghost 
by  his disciples? 
A. The feeding of the five thousand 
B. Calming of the storm and sea 
C. Healing the demoniac 
D. Walking on the sea. 
 
29. According to Luke, the healing of the paralytic was 
intended to show that 
A. God alone can forgive sins 
B. Jesus has authority to forgive sins 
C. the Holy Spirit makes intercession for sinners 
D. faith and prayer can heal. 
 
 
 
21. “Blessed be the Lord God of Israel, …” is a hymn of 
praise by 
A. the Virgin Mary at the Annunciation 
B. Zachariah at the birth of John the Baptist 
C. Simeon at the presentation of Jesus in the 
Temple 
D. Elizabeth at the visit of Mary. 
“…I adjure you by God, do not torment me, …” what is 
the significance of this statement? 
A. The demons wanted to reach an agreement 
with Jesus. 
B. The demons wanted to reach an agreement 
with Jesus. 
C. It is a recognition of the fact that demons 
are subject to Jesus. 
D. It shows that demons hate Jesus. 
A. The drought caused by Elijah’s curse  
B. Ahab’s evil in the sight of the LORD  
C. 
D 
The ravens ceased to feed Elijah 
Elijah’s fight from Ahab. 
 
30.
